question: An 18-year-old girl is diagnosed with Turner's syndrome. What is the most probable chromosomal makeup in this condition?

A 19-year-old female patient comes to the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and pubic hair, but the uterus and vagina are absent. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 16-year-old boy was seen by a surgeon with complaints of swelling and tenderness in his left testes. This condition is most likely be produced by thrombosis in which of the following veins?

A 19-year-old black, female patient is in her 32nd week of gestation and is admitted to the labor and delivery with a blood pressure of 165/110 mmHg and proteinuria in triage. During her pregnancy, she has suffered from agitation, behavioral changes, and edema. Which of the following best describes her pathogenesis?

answers.option: Abnormal placental vasculature and coagulation abnormalities

question: A 22-year-old obese, married nulliparous woman visits a gynecologist for irregular menstrual cycles for the past 1 year. On examination, it was found that she has hirsutism, alopecia, and acanthosis nigricans. Her ultrasound shows multiple fluid-filled sacs in the ovary. What does this indicate?

A 26-year-old married lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of multiple miscarriages. Further inquiry reveals that all her pregnancy losses occurred at 10-12th weeks of gestation. Which of the following best describes the condition?

A 3-month-old male infant is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) for a routine check-up. On thorough examination, it is found that he has cryptorchidism. Which of the following best describes the condition?

answers.option: Testes fail to descend into the scrotum
Accumulation of fluid in the testes

question: A 3-year-old male infant is brought to the clinic after his mother notices urine being expelled from the dorsal aspect of the penis. Abnormality in which of the following embryological structures results in this condition?

A 30-year-old male comes to the emergency department with complaints of fever for 2 days, with nocturia, intermittent stream, and pain during micturition. On palpation, the prostate feels boggy, rubbery, and tender to touch. Which of the following is the most probable cause of the condition?

A 34-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of abnormal menstrual bleeding. She reports bleeding for 9 days but the bleeding is regular, occurring after every 28 days. Which of the following best describes the bleeding pattern seen here?
A 40-year-old man has developed an infection of the testes. Which of the following lymph nodes is most likely to be enlarged?

A 45-year-old lady presents with heavy uterine bleeding. She reports irregular menstrual cycles for the past year. She is married but has no children and is clinically obese. An endometrial biopsy shows an increased gland to stroma ratio and the glands are cystically dilated. No nuclear atypia is seen. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 46-year-old female presents with a history of infection in her perineal region. On comprehensive examination, it was found that the superior boundary of superficial perineal space is torn. Which structure is most likely to be injured?

A 55-year-old female presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding. She was previously diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia on biopsy but she never returned for a follow-up and never received the treatment. Which of the following is the most probable cause of abnormal uterine bleeding?

A 62-year-old patient comes with a complaint of urgency, frequency, nocturia, and post-void dribbling. He is most probably suffering from prostatic enlargement. Which route of examination should be used to examine the prostate gland?
A 65-year-old male patient is admitted to the ward with lower urinary tract symptoms. He gets diagnosed with prostatic cancer. Which of the following is not consistent with prostatic carcinoma?

A 31-year-old female comes with a history of vaginal discharge. The discharge is green in color and is foul-smelling. On lab investigation, it is found to be due to pelvic inflammatory disease. Which of the following is related to this condition?

A female patient came to the gynecology outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of infertility. After lab investigation, it was found that the problem is with the conduction of sperms and ovum to the site of fertilization. What is the site of fertilization?
Which of the following is a common intermediate in the estrogen synthesis?

A 65-year-old male patient complains of urgency and frequency, especially at night. His urologist suspects benign prostate hyperplasia and places him on 5-alpha-reductase inhibitor therapy. What does this enzyme promote?

answers.option: Release of calcium from endoplasmic reticulum
Conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II

question: Which one of the following represents the female pelvis with a greater transverse diameter of the outlet than the anteroposterior diameter?

A mother is worried about her 17-year-old daughter who has not menstruated yet. She has well-developed secondary sexual characteristics. Ultrasound shows normal ovaries, but the uterus is absent. Which of the following is the most accurate condition describing her state?
A mother of two children comes to a family planning clinic for long-term contraception. What would be the most suitable method for her?

A 31-year-old female patient presents with a history of recurrent abortions. After a thorough investigation, it is found that the problem is with implantation. What is the most common site of implantation?
The addition of progestins for 10-12 days each month in an estrogen replacement therapy in menopausal women is recommended. What is the purpose of this?

answers.option: Reduces the risk of endometrial carcinoma due to estrogen
Reverses vulvar atrophy occurring in post menopausal women
Enhances metabolic effects of estrogen therapy
Enhances pharmacological properties of the estrogen
Reduces the risk of myocardial infarction

question: After a rotation in the psychiatric ward, the teacher asks about the reproductive health problems of women in Pakistan. Which option best describes good reproductive healthcare practice?

answers.option: Healthy sexuality, age related factors and intended births
Healthy sexuality, safe pregnancy and childbearing and intended births
Antenatal care, post natal care and child marriages
Social stigma, unsafe pregnancy and sexually transmitted diseases

question: A histopathologist observes simple columnar cells with simple tubular glands embedded in a thick stroma while examining a slide. Which of the following is represented by the slide?
Which process is affected by the blockage of the isthmus of the uterine tube?
Increasing the intake of which of the following should be done in women who are trying to conceive?
A 25-year-old girl presents to the emergency room after noticing an abdominal mass. She has pain in her hypogastric region and her menstrual cycle is irregular. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a part of the broad ligament?
A 45-year-old, para 3+0 female complains of heavy menstrual bleeding for the past year. She is taking prescribed medication but has seen no improvement. What will be the next step?
Which of the following does not form the boundary of a urogenital triangle?
Congenital anomalies can lead to the absence of certain organs. In incomplete Mullerian duct aplasia, which of the following would be present?
During a hysterectomy, the surgeon notices severe bleeding from the artery that remains within a true pelvis. Which one of these is most likely be the injured artery?
What is the primary source of progesterone in late pregnancy?

During model studies, the students were discussing the boundaries of the ischiorectal fossa. One student pointed out the structure forming its medial wall. Which structure forms the medial wall of the ischiorectal fossa?
Which of the following is an intermediate in progesterone synthesis?
Which one of the following best describes the components of reproductive health?

answers.option: General health of public, abortion and contraception
Public health, maternal health and contraception
Maternal health, child health and diseases of females
Health of youth, contraception, abortion, and sexually transmitted diseases

question: The external urethral sphincter is a part of which of the following structures?
Which one of the following is the primary function of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH)?
Which one of the following is not a part of uterine tubes or fallopian tubes?
The proliferation of the corpus luteum is promoted by prolactin which stimulates the production of which of the following?
Which of the following is associated with increased estrogen levels in the body?
Which of the following is not the side effect of estrogen in postmenopausal hormone replacement therapy?
Which of the following is the broad ligament that covers the uterine tube?
Which of these immunoglobulins can cross the placental barrier?
The secretion of inhibin is caused by which of the following?
Which type of cells are present in breast milk?

answers.option: Red blood cells and plasma cells

question: Which is the most common site of implantation of the fetus in an ectopic pregnancy?
How do oral contraceptives prevent pregnancy?

A 15-year-old girl comes to the outpatient department with complaints of cyclical lower abdominal pain. On examination, she has suprapubic swelling and a bluish bulge is seen in the vestibule. What is the most probable cause?
Which is the main ligament of support for the uterus?
Combined oral contraceptive pills contain which of the following?
A 25-year-old woman, mother of two children, wants to completely avoid further pregnancies. Which type of contraceptives should be suggested to her?
Hemoglobin and hematocrit levels are at their lowest levels at which stage of pregnancy?
Which of the following conditions may occur during pregnancy due to iodine deficiency in the expectant mother?
Which structure is present inferior to the prostate?
What is the normal position of a nulliparous uterus?
Which of the following is the predominant estrogen produced during the reproductive years?
What is the WHO recommended duration for exclusive breastfeeding?
Which surface of the bladder is not in contact with the levator ani?
Higher than normal levels of progesterone are found in which of the following conditions?
Highly coiled spiral arteries and edema in the endometrium are characteristic of which of the following stages of menstruation?

A 30-year-old female patient is being evaluated for infertility. Serum gonadotropins, estradiol, progesterone, and prolactin levels are measured in a test that is advised to obtain data by a blood sample on her 21st day of menstruation cycle. Which of the following will indicate if the cycle has been ovulatory or not?
Which of the following structures is present in the deep perineal pouch of a female?
In granulosa cells of follicles, testosterone is converted to beta-estradiol. Which of the following enzymes is important for this conversion?
Which of the following structures is present in superficial perineal pouch of the males?
Which one of the following options correctly defines infertility?

answers.option: Failure to conceive after six months of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after five years of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after one year of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after three years of unprotected intercourse
Failure to conceive after four years of unprotected intercourse

question: Which hormone makes the mucus of the cervix receptive to the sperm passage?
The levator prostate in males is a part of which of these structures?

Mrs. X is an influential social worker with experience of working with various government and non-government organizations. She now wants to take an initiative to empower the transgender community. She wants to make them realize that they should not be dependent on charity throughout their life and have to self-support themselves. This can lead to social, psychological, or even mental health problems in them. Which of the following would be the best way to bring the change without causing much damage?

answers.option: By creating a charitable organization so that they do not feel themselves to be powerless
Young people should assist marginalized population because they better understand their needs
By helping them create their own welfare organization and giving them charge because they better understand their own needs
By creating a public awareness about the rights of transgenders

question: Which of the following is primarily a prolactin-inhibiting hormone secreted by the hypothalamus?
Which of the following types of epithelia lines the rete testis?
An anal fissure is a tear in the thin moist mucosa that lines the anus and is a very painful condition. Which of the following nerves innervates this area?
Which of the following indicates the concentration of progesterone during the luteal phase of a menstrual cycle?
Which of the following conditions can cause retrograde ejaculation?
Which of these follicles is seen in the prepubertal stage?
There are two photomicrographs of the ovary shown to a medical student, prepubertal and pubertal stage. How can these two be differentiated?

answers.option: Primary follicles seen in prepubertal stage
Covered by stratified squamous epithelium and stratum granulosum at pubertal stage
Secondary follicles are seen in prepubertal stage
No atretic follicles are seen in pubertal stage

question: Which of these layers sloughs off during the menstrual period?
What is the major form of estrogen produced from menarche till menopause?
Prevention of ovulation by inhibiting gonadotropin release from the pituitary is the mechanism of action of which of the following contraceptive method?
Which one of the following releases prolactin inhibiting hormone?
Which of the following contains pseudostratified columnar epithelium along with corpora amylacea?
Which of the following parameter is not included in normal semen analysis according to the World Health Organization?
Testosterone is produced by the Leydig cells of the testes. Which of the following stimulates its secretion?
Tearing of the pelvic diaphragm during childbirth can lead to the paralysis of which of the following?
Which of the following drugs when administered orally causes cervical ripening in a pregnant woman to help induce labor?
Which of the following is an intermediate in the biogenic synthesis of adrenocortical hormones?
Which of the following structures is supplied by the inferior vesical artery?

answers.option: Posteroinferior part of bladder in females

question: The health status of any individual depends on how empowered they feel at any point in time. You are assessing the perceived self-image of individuals in the community. While interviewing a poor lady, she replies that she works as a housekeeper and the employer pays a very small amount because she belongs to a minority group. Which of the following describes this condition accurately?
The greater vestibular glands open into which of the following structures?

answers.option: Vestibule on each side of vaginal orifice

question: What is the free anterosuperior margin of the broad ligament of the uterus called?
Which of the following is the first hormone secreted by the placenta?
The descent of testes involves various hormonal and mechanical factors. Which of the following does not help in the descent of testes?
How many days does it take for the process of spermatogenesis to complete?
The early growth of the primary follicle in an ovary till the antral stage is stimulated by which of the following hormones?
Which of the following is the most active androgen?
The testes secrete various male sex hormones, collectively called androgens. Which of the following cells secretes testosterone?
The prostate is a branched tubuloalveolar gland that is divided into multiple zones. Which of the following zones make(s) up the majority of the gland?
Which one of the following is the principal and the most active form of the estrogenic hormone in circulation?
Which of the following is the precursor in testosterone production?
Which of the following is the major trophic hormone for the Sertoli cells?
Which of the following contains the ischiocavernosus muscle?

answers.option: Around the bulb of the penis

question: Which of the following represents the intratesticular ducts in males?

answers.option: Efferent ductules, rete testis, and ductus deferens
Efferent ductules, rete testis, and tubuli recti

question: The parasympathetic preganglionic fibers in pelvic splanchnic nerve synapse with which of the following?

answers.option: Ganglia in or near the visceral wall or pelvic plexus

question: What is the most common site of an ectopic tubal pregnancy?
The lumen of the seminal vesicle is highly irregular, with a honeycomb appearance. Which of the following types of epithelia is present in the seminal vesicle?
Which of the following shapes is the normal female type, characterized by a typically rounded oval pelvic inlet?
Which of the following structures is most likely to be damaged by a stab wound in the ischiorectal fossa about 2 centimeters lateral to the anal canal?
Which of the following is true regarding the vaginal mucosa?

answers.option: It does not possess elastic fibers
It is lubricated by the glands located in the cervix
It is lined by stratified columnar epithelium
It is lined by stratified squamous keratinized epithelium

question: Which of the following adverse effects is not associated with the use of oral contraceptives?
Which impairment of the male reproductive system will not lead to sterility?
The prostate gland is which of the following types?
Which of the following congenital malformations most commonly causes recurrent abortions?
Complete failure of the fusion of the Mullerian duct can result in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following protects young women against heart disease?

Which of the following represents the stage in which the oocyte is surrounded by the single layer of cuboidal cells?
Which of the following represents the stage in which the follicle is arrested in the prophase-I of the first meiotic division?
Which of the following regions of the Fallopian tubes has the most numerous ciliated cells?
Which of the following is a synthetic estrogen used in oral contraceptives?
Which of the following is correct?

answers.option: Estrogens are mainly excreted in the urine unchanged
Tamoxifen is used to treat infertility

question: Which of the following is related to twin-twin transfusion syndrome?
A fetus is born with an enlarged clitoris and fused labia majora/minora. Ultrasound confirms that the fetus is female. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Where are peg cells found?
Which nerve provides innervation to the lower one-fifth of the vagina and receives touch and temperature sensations?
What is the first hormone produced by the placenta?

A 30-year-old man comes to the outpatient department with pain in the anal region. Examination reveals abscesses on the anal glands above the pectinate line. The infection has eroded the lateral wall of the anal canal. Where is the infection most likely to spread after the anal canal?
Which of the following is produced by Leydig cells?
How many carbons are there in androstenedione?

A young lady presents with irregular vaginal bleeding. She is concerned for her health because her mother had cervical carcinoma. The gynecologist advises a pap smear testing which reveals cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia is strongly associated with which of these?
Phenylketonuria is a genetic disorder due to a deficiency of which of the following enzymes?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?
